1.text: Canst thou draw out the leviathan with a hook, or canst thou tie his tongue with a cord?

2.text: Canst thou put a ring in his nose, or bore through his jaw with a buckle?

3.text: Will he make many supplications to thee, or speak soft words to thee?

4.text: Will he make a covenant with thee, and wilt thou take him to be a servant for ever?

5.text: Shalt thou play with him as with a bird, or tie him up for thy handmaids?

6.text: Shall friends cut him in pieces, shall merchants divide him?

7.text: Wilt thou fill nets with his skin, and the cabins of fishes with his head?

8.text: Lay thy hand upon him : remember the battle, and speak no more.

9.text: Behold his hope shall fail him, and in the sight of all he shall be cast down.

10.text: I will not stir him up, like one that is cruel : for who can resist my countenance?

11.text: Who hath given me before that I should repay him? All things that are under heaven are mine.

12.text: I will not spare him, nor his mighty words, and framed to make supplication.

13.text: Who can discover the face of his garment? or who can go into the midst of his mouth?

14.text: Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible round about.

15.text: His body is like molten shields, shut close up with scales pressing upon one another.

16.text: One is joined to another, and not so much as any air can come between them :

17.text: They stick one to another and they hold one another fast, and shall not be separated.

18.text: His sneezing is like the shining of fire, and his eyes like the eyelids of the morning.

19.text: Out of his mouth go forth lamps, like torches of lighted fire.

20.text: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, like that of a pot heated and boiling.

21.text: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame cometh forth out of his mouth.

22.text: In his neck strength shall dwell, and want goeth before his face.

23.text: The members of his flesh cleave one to another : he shall send lightnings against him, and they shall not be carried to another place.

24.text: His heart shall be as hard as a stone, and as firm as a smithâ€™s anvil.

25.text: When he shall raise him up, the angels shall fear, and being affrighted shall purify themselves.

26.text: When a sword shall lay at him, it shall not be able to hold, nor a spear, nor a breastplate.

27.text: For he shall esteem iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.

28.text: The archer shall not put him to flight, the stones of the sling are to him like stubble.

29.text: As stubble will he esteem the hammer, and he will laugh him to scorn who shaketh the spear.

30.text: The beams of the sun shall be under him, and he shall strew gold under him like mire.

31.text: He shall make the deep sea to boil like a pot, and shall make it as when ointments boil.

32.text: A path shall shine after him, he shall esteem the deep as growing old.

33.text: There is no power upon earth that can be compared with him who was made to fear no one.

34.text: He beholdeth every high thing, he is king over all the children of pride.
